text: I suppose the attack model is: a small number of people could have access to the server. If code were sitting, unobfuscated on disk, it is very easy to read/take. If it is only stored as an in-memory structure in the process, doing anything useful with it becomes much more difficult.

elements.text: I suppose the attack model is: a small number of people could have access to the server. If code were sitting, unobfuscated on disk, it is very easy to read/take. If it is only stored as an in-memory structure in the process, doing anything useful with it becomes much more difficult.

text: Do you not have control over file permissions in this model? Those generally work to prevent others from reading your data.
